00009     OLBFGS::OLBFGS(Controller* controller, size_t memLength) : TransformController(controller) {
00010         
00011         this->memLength = memLength;
00012 
00013         y = Vector(controller->getNumParams()); 
00014         s = Vector(controller->getNumParams()); 
00015         p = Vector(controller->getNumParams());
00016         trace = Vector(controller->getNumParams());

00024     Vector OLBFGS::updateDirection(Vector& s, Vector& y, Vector& newP) {
00025 
00026         double sy = inner_prod(s,y); //to compute rho in BFGS
00027 
00028         cout<<"sy = "<<sy<<endl;
00029 
00030 
00031         // Remove old elements if we have too many
00032         if (rho.size()>=memLength){
00033             sArray.pop_front();
00034             yArray.pop_front();
00035             rho.pop_front();
00036         }
00037 
00038         // Add new elements
00039         sArray.push_back(s);
00040         yArray.push_back(y);
00041         rho.push_back(1.0/sy);
00042         
00043         Vector alpha(sArray.size() + 1);
00044 
00045 
00046         // backward sweep using reverse iterators
00047         vecListRIt si = sArray.rbegin();
00048         vecListRIt yi = yArray.rbegin();
00049         rhoListRIt ri = rho.rbegin();
00050         for(int i=0; si != sArray.rend(); si++, yi++, ri++, i++){
00051             alpha[i] = (*ri) * inner_prod(*si, newP);
00052             newP -= alpha[i]*(*yi);
00053         }
00054 
00055         cout<<"alpha = "<<alpha<<endl;
00056         cout<<"newP = "<<newP<<endl;
00057 
00058         newP = (sy/inner_prod(y,y))*newP;
00059 
00060         cout<<"newP(2) = "<<newP<<endl;
00061 
00062         //forward sweep
00063         double beta;
00064 
00065         // forward sweep using normal iterators
00066         vecListIt sj = sArray.begin();
00067         vecListIt yj = yArray.begin();
00068         rhoListIt rj = rho.begin();
00069         for(int j=0; sj != sArray.end(); sj++, yj++, rj++, j++){
00070             beta = (*rj)*inner_prod(*yj,newP);
00071             newP += (*sj)*(alpha[j]-beta);
00072         }
00073 
00074         cout<<"newP(3) = "<<newP<<endl;
00075 
00076         return newP;
00077     }

00083     void OLBFGS::discountTrace() {
00084 
00085         trace *= discountFactor;
00086     }

00104     void OLBFGS::getAction(Observation& obs, Vector& action, bool computeGrad) {
00105 
00106         assert(obs.getFeatures().size1() == (size_t)getInputDim());
00107     
00108         // Trace isn't aggregated in OLBFGS, but rather in the local trace variable in instantStep()
00109         controller->resetTrace();    
00110         controller->getAction(obs, action, computeGrad);
00111 
00112         // Store obs and action for later use in instantStep()
00113         lastAction = action;
00114         lastObs = obs;
00115 
00116     }
00117

00119     void OLBFGS::resetTrace() {
00120         trace.clear();
00121     }
00122

00124     void OLBFGS::resetGrad() {
00125         resetTrace();
00126         OLBFGSSteps = 0;
00127         yArray.clear();
00128         sArray.clear();
00129         rho.clear();
00130     }

00137         this->stepSize = stepSize;
00138         controller->setStepSize(stepSize);
00139     }

00147     void OLBFGS::instantStep(Vector& reward) {
00148 
00149         /* Tao's original code
00150         w += s; 
00151         y= g;
00152         g = getGradient(); //f(w,state_t,a_t);  state at *t*
00153         y = g-y;
00154         g = getGradient();
00155         p = updateDirection(s, y);
00156         */
00157         
00158 
00159         //extract first gradient from the trace
00160         controller->resetTrace();
00161         Vector error(lastAction - reward);
00162         ((RegressionController*)controller)->setLastReward(error);
00163         controller->computePartialsAndFeedback(lastObs, 0); 
00164         y.clear();
00165         controller->reduce(y, Approximator::TRACES);
00166         g = -y;
00167         if (OLBFGSSteps == 0) p = g; // Can't have p=0 on first step
00168         
00169         cout<<"first sample:\n\ty="<<y<<endl;
00170         cout<<"\tg="<<g<<endl;
00171         
00172         
00173         // Update weights in direction of previous solution "p" (s = stepSize*p)
00174         noalias(s) = stepSize*p;
00175         controller->scatter(p, Approximator::GRADS);
00176         controller->batchStep(); // Do the step
00177 
00178         cout<<"weight update:\n\tp="<<p<<endl;
00179         cout<<"\tstep size="<<stepSize<<endl;
00180         cout<<"\ts="<<s<<endl;
00181         cout<<"\tNew weights=";
00182         write(cout);
00183         
00184         // Get second sample with new weights. 
00185 
00186         controller->getAction(lastObs, lastAction, false); // False=dont compute grad cos we
00187                                                             //want to override the chosen action 
00188         
00189         // Override grad computation, forcing it to assume the same action was chosen
00190         controller->resetTrace();
00191         error = lastAction - reward;
00192         ((RegressionController*)controller)->setLastReward(error);
00193         controller->computePartialsAndFeedback(lastObs, 0); 
00194 
00195         cout<<"second sample:\n\ty="<<y<<endl;
00196 
00197         // Compute difference in the gradients y = reward[0]*(second
00198         // sample - first sample), trace is not a factor since it
00199         // would cancel out anyway
00200         y *= -1;        // y starts as first sample, so negate it.
00201         cout<<"\ty * -1="<<y<<endl;
00202         controller->reduce(y, Approximator::TRACES); // Grab new grad, add directly to y
00203         cout<<"\ty' - y="<<y<<endl;
00204 
00205 
00206         // Update statistics
00207         p = updateDirection(s, y, g);
00208         OLBFGSSteps++;
00209 
00210         cout<<"New p="<<p<<endl;
00211 
00212     }

00215     void OLBFGS::accumulateGrad(double reward, Observation& newObs) {
00216         throw runtime_error("Accumulating gradients doesn't make sense with olBFGS\n");
00217     }
